intro: Pseuderanthemum blumei, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, while the stems are square and somewhat woody. Pseuderanthemum blumei is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in partial shade.
